title: WinJockey Command
description: The definition for a WinJockey Command

CliCommand.description:
The name or path of an executable.
Variables in CMD syntax, like %AppData% are expanded.
$NLC$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the NovaLaunch config directory.
$WSD$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the directory, presented most recent in the Windows Explorer

ShellCommand.description:
A Windows shell command.
Variables in CMD syntax, like %AppData% are expanded.
$NLC$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the NovaLaunch config directory.
$WSD$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the directory, presented most recent in the Windows Explorer

CliCommandArguments.description:
A string passed as command line arguments.
Variables in CMD syntax, like %AppData% are expanded.
$NLC$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the NovaLaunch config directory.
$WSD$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the directory, presented most recent in the Windows Explorer
$WSS$ is replaced by the double-quoted absolute path of the first selected file or directory in the most recently used Windows Explorer window
$WSSS$ is replaced by the whitespace separated list of double-quoted absolute paths of all selected files and directories in the most recently used Windows Explorer window

WorkingDirectory.description:
The current working directory for the new process.
Variables in CMD syntax, like %AppData% are expanded.
$NLC$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the NovaLaunch config directory.
$WSD$ is replaced with the unquoted absolute path of the directory, presented most recent in the Windows Explorer

VirtualDesktopNumber.description: The number of the targeted virtual desktop

ScreenNumber.description: The number of the targeted screen

mqttTopic.description: Sets the MQTT topic to subscribe to

action.description: Configures the action of the command

browser.description: The optional alternative browser to use

windowStyle.description: The desired window state for the main window of the new process

windowPosition.description: The new boundary for the currently active window

windowStyle.description: The desired window state for the currently active window
